n. a house plastered with lac and other combustible substances (such a house was built for the reception of the pāṇḍava princes in vāraṇāvata by purocana , at the instigation of duryodhana , the object being to burn them alive when they were asleep after a festival ; warned by vidura , they discovered the dangerous character of their abode , and dug an underground passage ; next having invited an outcaste woman with her five sons , they first stupefied them with wine , and then having burnt purocana in his own house , set fire to the house of lac , and , leaving the charred bodies of the woman and her sons inside , escaped by the underground passage) MBh. i , 313 ; 2250 and 5864
